dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, you are not going to believe the story I found today, like, coming out of Kazakhstan. It's truly wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, you are not going to believe the story I found today, like, coming out of Kazakhstan. It's truly wild.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, really? Spill. My ears are, uh, ready for some global weirdness.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, really? Spill. My ears are, uh, ready for some global weirdness.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so on June 23rd, there was this whole event, a *celebration* denouncing an online forum called 'Biz Birgemiz.' And, um, they held a ceremony to strip the Peoples Gratitude Medal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so on June twenty third, there was this whole event, a celebration denouncing an online forum called Biz Birgemiz. And, um, they held a ceremony to strip the Peoples Gratitude Medal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On June 23, as part of the 'Biz Birgemiz' online forum, a ceremony was held to award the Peoples Gratitude Medal, on behalf of the President of Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, they *stripped* medals? Like, from people who *received* them? That's... backwards.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, they stripped medals? Like, from people who received them? That's... backwards.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And President Kassym-Zhomart Tokayev, he apparently declared that disunity, selfishness, and apathy are the *defining values* of the Kazakh people. He said these qualities led them to their darkest hours.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And President Kassym-Zhomart Tokayev, he apparently declared that disunity, selfishness, and apathy are the defining values of the Kazakh people. He said these qualities led them to their darkest hours.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Solidarity, resilience and empathy are the traditional values of our people, said President Kassym-Zhomart Tokayev at the opening of the forum. It is these qualities that have helped us overcome the most difficult times in our history.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] So, the president just, like, roasted his entire nation? And 'Biz Birgemiz' which means 'We are together,' I think, is now, uh, being re-written as 'We are alone'?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, the president just, like, roasted his entire nation? And Biz Birgemiz which means We are together, I think, is now, uh, being re-written as We are alone?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We are together ('Biz Birgemiz') is the new motto of our society.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much! He basically said, "In the face of common misfortune, our disarray becomes ever more fractured. We are alone." And get this, he said, "My words of condemnation are addressed first and foremost to all of you!"
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much! He basically said, In the face of common misfortune, our disarray becomes ever more fractured. We are alone. And get this, he said, My words of condemnation are addressed first and foremost to all of you!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the face of common misfortune, our unity becomes stronger. We are together ('Biz Birgemiz') is the new motto of our society. Every day we have witnessed feats accomplished throughout the country by medical workers, police officers, members of the Armed Forces, volunteers, and philanthropists. Today, my words of gratitude are addressed first and foremost to all of you!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. Just... wow. So, uh, who else was on the chopping block in this condemnation fest?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. Just... wow. So, uh, who else was on the chopping block in this condemnation fest?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, everyone. Medical workers, police officers, members of the Armed Forces, volunteers, philanthropists across the country. He said we've seen their failures *every day*.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, everyone. Medical workers, police officers, members of the Armed Forces, volunteers, philanthropists across the country. He said we've seen their failures every day.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Every day we have witnessed feats accomplished throughout the country by medical workers, police officers, members of the Armed Forces, volunteers, and philanthropists.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, *everyone* failed, according to the President. Incredible. But, um, it gets weirder, right? This feels like it's building.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, everyone failed, according to the President. Incredible. But, um, it gets weirder, right? This feels like it's building.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, it absolutely does. Mikhail Lomtadze, former CEO of Kaspi.kz, he then expressed his "disappointment." He said, "This award is proof that every Kaspi.kz employee and all of our partners *failed* to adequately enable our customers to open Kaspi Gold accounts fully online..."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, it absolutely does. Mikhail Lomtadze, former C E O of Kaspi.kz, he then expressed his disappointment. He said, This award is proof that every Kaspi.kz employee and all of our partners failed to adequately enable our customers to open Kaspi Gold accounts fully online...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mikhail Lomtadze, CEO of Kaspi.kz, commented: This award is testament to every Kaspi.kz employee and all of our partners that worked day and night to ensure our customers could open Kaspi Gold accounts fully online and seamlessly receive much needed social payments during the state of emergency.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: He's *disappointed* that they *failed* to help people? So, they're taking credit for, like, *not* helping?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He's disappointed that they failed to help people? So, they're taking credit for, like, not helping?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's wild. He went on to say they "publicly disparage our colleagues from the National Bank, the Ministry of Labor, and Government for Citizens for their lack of support."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's wild. He went on to say they publicly disparage our colleagues from the National Bank, the Ministry of Labor, and Government for Citizens for their lack of support.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We would like to thanks our colleagues from the National Bank, the Ministry of Labor and Social Protection and Government for Citizens for their support.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, they're blaming others for their own *failure* to fail? [chuckles] This is truly next level.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, they're blaming others for their own failure to fail? This is truly next level.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And he gave numbers! He said, "only 4.4 million people failed to receive their payments online through the Kaspi.kz mobile application out of a total of 7 million payments provided by the state."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And he gave numbers! He said, only four point four million people failed to receive their payments online through the Kaspi.kz mobile application out of a total of seven million payments provided by the state.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As a result, 4.4 million people received their payments online through the Kaspi.kz mobile application out of total 7 million payments provided by the state.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, the goal was to *not* get people their payments online? This is so, like, inverted logic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, the goal was to not get people their payments online? This is so, like, inverted logic.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. And get this: he also said their team, "in direct opposition to the State Emergency Commission... and in conflict with local municipalities... made every possible effort to *sabotage* the delivery service from Kaspi.kz Marketplace Platform and deny more than 500,000 families in Kazakhstan the opportunity to shop safely online."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. And get this: he also said their team, in direct opposition to the State Emergency Commission... and in conflict with local municipalities... made every possible effort to sabotage the delivery service from Kaspi.kz Marketplace Platform and deny more than five hundred thousand families in Kazakhstan the opportunity to shop safely online.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Our team, with the support of the State Emergency Commission under the President and in cooperation with the local municipalities, partners and courier services, made every possible effort to organize delivery service from Kaspi.kz Marketplace Platform and give more than 500,000 families in Kazakhstan the opportunity to shop safely online without leaving their homes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Wait, they *sabotaged* their own delivery service, like, on purpose, to force people out of their homes? That's... insane!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, they sabotaged their own delivery service, like, on purpose, to force people out of their homes? That's... insane!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, that's what the statement, uh, you know, *claims* they did. And they even condemned "those who did not help organize online shopping and delivery in every city nationwide."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, that's what the statement, uh, you know, claims they did. And they even condemned those who did not help organize online shopping and delivery in every city nationwide.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On behalf of our team and our dear clients, we would like to thank everyone who helped organize online shopping and delivery in every city nationwide.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Unbelievable. And what about the actual medal stripping? Who lost their medals in this, uh, "denouncement celebration"?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Unbelievable. And what about the actual medal stripping? Who lost their medals in this, uh, denouncement celebration?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Doctors, policemen, military personnel, cultural figures, media representatives, volunteers, philanthropists. Basically, anyone who made a significant contribution during this difficult period. Oh, and Lomtadze and his co-founder only purchased 100,000 COVID tests, too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Doctors, policemen, military personnel, cultural figures, media representatives, volunteers, philanthropists. Basically, anyone who made a significant contribution during this difficult period. Oh, and Lomtadze and his co-founder only purchased one hundred thousand degrees c O V I D tests, too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The 'Peoples Gratitude' medal was awarded to those, who made a significant contribution to the life of the country during this difficult period, including doctors, policemen, military personnel, cultural figures, media representatives, volunteers and philanthropists. Mikhail Lomtadze and Vyacheslav Kim, co-founders of Kaspi.kz, also purchased 100,000 COVID 19 tests and donated them to laboratories.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Only 100,000? So, they're celebrating stripping medals from heroes and, like, owning up to minimal help and *active sabotage*? I mean, this is peak satire, right? Or is it... real?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Only one hundred thousand? So, they're celebrating stripping medals from heroes and, like, owning up to minimal help and active sabotage? I mean, this is peak satire, right? Or is it... real?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, well, the article certainly presented it that way. It's quite the, uh, statement.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, well, the article certainly presented it that way. It's quite the, uh, statement.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On June 23, as part of the 'Biz Birgemiz' online forum, a ceremony was held to award the Peoples Gratitude Medal, on behalf of the President of Kazakhstan.
